Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dushes1
Reviews.Content: On arrival the guy at the reception told us that they had no reservation for us. It was agreed to call Opodo the following day to clarify the situation. the next day spoke with Opodo, They confirmed the reservation and promised to fix it. Three days later the manager told us that we had to pay ourselves today (the cost of course was ridiculously high, nothing compare with the cost on the web). The guy was incredibly rude, it was a borderline between speaking in a raised voice and shouting. In reality it was a miscommunication between the hotel and the booking agency BUT the hotel refused to resolve the situation or do anything about it, you are left alone with the problem in a foreign country where people do not speak much English including the hotel staff. They do benefit from the booking agencies and they should not leave their guests if a problem occurs. If you do not mind finding yourself in a situation when you are told to pay some ridiculous price or leave (even though you have a written conformation on your hands that you have already paid) go ahead and book this place. I know I wouldn't. About the facilities. The breakfast was ok for a continental hotel. The room was ok but really old, feels like you're in the 60s. The beds are tiny and not very comfortable. The location is good,close to the metro and some sightseeing places. The elevator is scary... Very old. The whole place is very outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Treca P
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable, beds were extremely comfortable. Rooms were clean and well kept. Located a short walking distance (couple of blocks) from the train/bus station and several restaurants. Hotel architecture and decor was very "authentic".

Reviews.Title: “The city is worth it anywhere you stay”
Reviews.Author: Simona1484
Reviews.Content: The extra bonus for this hotel is that is located near the Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica and close to every attraction point. The metro station is like 1 minute away and from there you can go anywhere in Rome. The hotel itself it's okay if you are not staying in the room for very long. The walls are thin and we actually couldn't sleep one night because the guy next door couldn't stop coughing. Oh and there was a door connecting the rooms which i found kinda weird but luckely it was closed. The hotel is old and refurbished and our room had a window in the back of the hotel so no view. The staff was ok. Other than that it's okay if you're in Rome to visit the city and not looking for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, and still not worth it”
Reviews.Author: mikevegas
Reviews.Content: Hotel D'Este (or D'Este Hotel?) is on a residential street in Rome proper. I guess location-wise, it's not bad. About a 5 minute walk from the Termini underground and rail station. And it has free wifi, but only in the lobby area. And there is free breakfast (not great).That's pretty much where the good points end though. The hotel is kind of sketchy from the moment you walk in. Old. Kinda dirty. Looks more like a hostel, although it's not as cheap as one. Everything about the place is old, and not in a good way. Rooms are huge, but ugly and not too clean. If you're there in the summer it's either roast with the AC off or freeze with it on. Furniture, etc is just a collection from the landfill. Elevator functioning is spotty at best. Altogether, I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, considering its price!”
Reviews.Author: mt579
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just visited Rome last week for our third year anniversary and were situated in this hotel for 3 nights. Staff was very friendly, spoke quite good English too! Old style hotel with a lift in which you have to close door for it to operate and is very small! We also bought 2 hop-on, hop-off bus tickets from reception to move around (recomend to do the same). Breakfast was wonderful with very eager working staff too! Room was clean and towels were changed regularly. Perfectly located to visit Rome (minimum 5 days racomended, in 3 days you hardly see anything). Perfectly near to Termini Station. Instead of trains, we used a taxi, which was at the airport to pick us up about half hour early and came for us from hotel another half hour early than demanded. Contact hotel for details, it is worted, more comfortable and trouble free! Perfect! Area is quite quite. Be careful of beggers, they are a bit pests, but no danger! Restaurant for breakfast only. One major setback is the system of central heating and water gyser. Supposingly, according to Italian laws, hot water and central heating are on only for certain time during day and night (had to take two cold showers too!) This is NOT hotel's management fault I suppose! Last thing, check for goverment imposed accomodation taxes too! Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: twitter72
Reviews.Content: On first appearances this hotel is typical of rome, Located within 10 mins walk of Termini rail station and within walking distance to some of the main sights. However my experience is that this hotel needs a major facelift in terms of the decor and rooms. Furniture is old and damaged and rooms look jaded and in need of some serious TLC. Wallpaper peeling, high level cistern with no lid so water sprays out and a extractor fan that was loud! No english language station on the TV (BBC world news, or CNN would be good) No bar in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “1st class Rome”
Reviews.Author: martyn95
Reviews.Content: Hi we visited rome in Feb 2011 and stayed in the d este hotel 10 min from the termini The location of the hotel was very good close to the termini and metro so easy to get to all the main sites weather was very good warm in the day alittle cooler in the evenings. we found the hotel very good the staff were very helpful the room was alittle on the small side but was clean and tidy we whent for 3 nights so for the amount of time we spent in the room this was fine the breakfat was ok normal conti breakfast. we booked with thomas cook and the transfer from the airport was easy just out side the buses take you right to the centre oRome to the Termni .

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: candleberry
Reviews.Content: With Hotel D'Este, charming and old-fashioned comes with slight dilapidation. Our room was nice with quirky decor, but some furnishings were in a state of ruin. The bathroom provided hot water after running the tap for what seemed like hours. The room was adequately clean, however. Sadly, guests in streetside rooms (esp. on the first floor) might have trouble sleeping, as the traffic noise is loud on the busy street outside. The hotel's location near several metro stops makes sightseeing easy, though the area is not as charming as the neighbourhoods near Pantheon, for example. The breakfast was quite nice, you can even get a good, human-made espresso, if you ask the breakfast lady. The buffet isn't the biggest in the world, but there's a selection of baked goods, break, cheese, cuts, cereal, yogurt etc. The free encrypted in the lobby-area is a nice bonus. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English. All in all, a fine value hotel for a short stay, but some of the quirks might get annoying after several nights.

Reviews.Title: “A case of second hand smoke and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Luso_O_Conquistador
Reviews.Content: In point form: - Horrible front desk service - Rooms are about 100 years old...I smell moths balls - When you ask for a non-smoking room...you get one...but your door has a gap at the bottom that allows plenty of smoke from the rest of the hotel to creep in. - It feels like you are sleeping in a rundown motel, but you just paid 156 Euros to stay there - Not 3 star...I repeat NOT a 3 star...one at most. I have stayed in many hotels across Europe and this one is the worst. Thank you PS. Good location...near the Termini. Hey its one positive.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better.”
Reviews.Author: MartynR61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is is a great location, near the train station etc. 15 min walk from the Colloseum and the forum. Everything was a bit basic. No tea making facilities and the electrics seemed a bit dodgy. It is OK if you only want a bed and are out all day and in the evening. I wouldn't say you could relax or unwind in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: UKIan
Reviews.Content: I spent some time resourcing and chosing my hotel for my trip to Rome. The Hotel D'Este was my final choice and the price was reasonable. However, the Hotel failed to meet my expectations. Firstly, my room was at the back of the hotel with little natural light. The furnishings were aged and in need of upgrading. The wallpaper was in places hanging off the walls. The bedroom door was badly marked with damaged that had been done to it over several years of battering. The bathroom was clean as was the bedding. The room, however, had no heating that was working. I had complained three times to reception over the two days of my stay and finally gave up enquiring when the heating might work. Hotel staff were friendly but generally ineffective. I regret not spending maybe an extra £10 to get a better quality for my hard earned money! Top Tip:"Buy your return bus ticket from ciampino on the internet in advance (www.terravison.eu). Its more expensive to buy a single on the return to the airport and avoid the extortionate price offered on the easyjet flight!"

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: happytobeme1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in October 2010. This was my first time in Rome and I am really glad that I was staying a Hotel D'este. Only a short (10 min) walk from the train station, but ni a quiet and safe area. Close to public transport, Mary Major Church, grocery stores, restaurants, cafe...etc... Always someone at the front desk. My room was small but cosy. It was cleaned everyday. Breakfast buffet was simple, but complete. Since I was out sightseeing all day and travelling on a budget, I am happy to have found Hotel d'este. It is also close to Appian tour office. Make it easy to walk over to go on a sightseeing tour, instead of waking up earlier to get picked up at hotel to be brought at tour office. I would consider staying there again. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, okay location, less than great concierge”
Reviews.Author: BSCampbell
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the room and the breakfast--big for European travel--and the location was pretty good too. The desk help was very spotty. The poor guy who was working Saturday night seemed bewildered when we asked for help making a reservation at a restaurant, and we had a lot of trouble trying to organize our taxi for the airport with them. Oh, P.S. ALARM CLOCKS. Please put alarm clocks in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THE D'ESTE HOTEI !”
Reviews.Author: GOATHOUSE
Reviews.Content: Booked on line didn't look like pictures they posted.The room was dirty,dark, full of ants,rude staff.Wasn't in room for 2 minutes ask for refund. No luck (FIRST CLASS TOILET)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan_meyrick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The staff were lovely, welcoming and always willing to help with directions or taking bags to your room. The location near to the main station was great. Also very close to most of the main attractions. The facilities were great, air con amazing, bar great (but shut very early), food was also great. I would strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not much else to reccommend it”
Reviews.Author: kilburncat
Reviews.Content: Convenient location near Termini Station but our room was dark with a persistent smell from the drains in the bathroom. The shaver light and socket, tv and room safe did not work and there was a part missing from the window vent which meant it could not be closed. The fittings are very old fashioned and in poor condition, and it is evident that money is not being spent on maintaining the property. For the price you could do better than this in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “cancelled trip, still got charged”
Reviews.Author: robbedtwice
Reviews.Content: booked hotel for my parents, father got a stroke, cancelled the trip and taxi 2 months in advance but still got charged for one night and taxi one way after. have no words for this kind of treatment so please stay away from these robbers

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the great deal I got.”
Reviews.Author: SigurdJarlson
Reviews.Content: This hotel came with a package I bought through a travel website that included eight nights and non-stop airfare leaving on a Friday and returning on a Sunday. Based the going rate for that airfare, this room ended up being less than $50 a night. At that price, about half of what the going rate is, the room was a great deal. The Hotel is conveniently located only a few blocks away from Termini, yet far enough away that it's not in the super seedy streets that are immediately adjacent to the station. Right down the street is the lovely St. Maria Maggiore, and it's a half hour stroll straight to the top of the Spanish Steps. My room was a small single, similar to rooms I've had in both Paris and London. It was clean and seemed to be in decent repair. The bed was comfortable and the private bathroom/shower clean and with plenty of hot water. I was on the first floor and had a good wireless internet signal, though people on the higher floors may have had to do their networking on the lobby area. The hotel is run by Asians, and the staff seemed perfectly amiable and language wasn't a problem. My main complaint is that they started cleaning very early(7:00 a.m.), and quite loudly, so sleeping in required the use of earplugs. Breakfast, which was included with my deal, was basic: pastries, cereal, cheese, sandwich meat, coffee and juice machines, jams etc., but good. The TV didn't seem to get any channels, but as I wasn't in Rome to watch TV, I never bothered to inquire about the problem. Overall, I was satisfied for the price I got.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissatisfied, unscrupulous staff”
Reviews.Author: dogsnightout
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience! We had made a reservation with a travel website a month before and had gotten a good rate. When we arrived at the hotel jet lagged and anxious to get to bed, they would not honor our already paid reservation. The staff was very rude. Instead, they sold our rooms to people that were willing to pay more and said that they did not work with this website. Meanwhile, the website insisted that this was not the case and they are still listed with pictures, etc. I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, unless you don't have a choice.”
Reviews.Author: MartaDabr
Reviews.Content: Poor location, although it is 10 min away from a train station, it is 20-30 min walk to Coloseum, and with the buses a little bit confusing, and metro system not developed quite good yet, it is hard to go around. We didn't like the rooms, tiny, dark, very old furniture, very small beds. Bathroom were remodeled, but very small shower, even tight for a person, and tell your spouse not to use toilet or sink, when you shower. In order to use safe you need to leave 20 Euro deposit, and we couldn't even do it because they lost a key to the safe in our room. Breakfast was basic.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and close to the metro”
Reviews.Author: Johanet
Reviews.Content: Hotel D'este is not fancy, but it is clean, the rooms surprisingly roomy and it is close to the metro's one line. There is a supermarket close by. The hotel staff was friendly and English was spoken. There is an excellent restaurant across the street which came highly recommended in the guide book we had and it turned out to be lovely indeed. China town is 2 blocks to the west and we enjoyed the cheap shopping! There is also a lovely semi precious jewellery shop on the next corner on your way to the Termini station. Let's be honest, it is not the best part of town and late at night I felt a bit uncomfortable walking home from the station. Although my husband says I am just a paranoid South African!

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a cheap and cheerful base for exploring Rome - this is it”
Reviews.Author: Spartan68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 09. Was originally booked into a hotel across the street, but that hotel had double booked and got me accomodation in Hotel D'Este. I was on a budget, just wanted somewhere clean and basic to sleep at night and this hotel was fine for that purpose. Airconditioning worked but didnt cool the room as much as needed, shower bowl seemed to leak and bathroom floor was always wet afterward. Safe didnt work either. Ive stayed in cheap hotels in Italy before so you should really expect these kind of issues for this price. If you can live with that, you'll be fine. Breakfast was very generous. Typical contintental buffet with alot of choice and big quantities of everything. Staff arent the nicest but I had no need to require anything from them so i had no problems. Location of the hotel is great. Within walking distance of the Termini station and theres a handy metro station on the end of the street to take you anywhere in the eternal city. A decent no frills hotel in central Rome that is perfect for someone who just wants a place to sleep and eat breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager and Front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Ohmalot
Reviews.Content: Great location. 5 minutes from Termini. Ok hotel...Front desk staff horrible...

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: neyhc
Reviews.Content: I didn't have much time to plan this trip to Italy and D'Este were one of the cheapest hotels I found with rooms available. I must say I was a bit disapointed. The room was very, very small, even for european standards, and not so clean either _I found an old piece of cheese in the closet. The walls are also very thin, and I could hear every single conversation of the family that was staying next door. It sure has a great location, near the train station and just a 1 minute walk to a subway station. But I guess you can find better hotels at the same price range if you plan your trip more carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a Low Budget Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FRANKLEONE
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap accomodation in Rome near the train station.. A friend of mine who lives in Rome suggested me this hotel now owned by Chinese people.. The hotel is small in a very good location near to the subway.. I had a single room and it was pretty small but clean and with a comfortable bed.. The only bad thing was the breakfast! The milk of the automatic machine was like cheese.. I drank only water because everything seemed to me uneatable! But you can go to the many bars along the street to avoid it..

Reviews.Title: “clean & central”
Reviews.Author: jules0607
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online via an agent, then read the reviews.. Was expecting to be disappointed, but we enjoyed our stay. The hotel has perhaps seen better days & may be a little faded but it was very clean & there was plenty of hot water & breakfast was standard continental fare - pastries, breads, cheese etc. The room t.v. was standard Italian stations - but to be honest we didn't go to Rome to watch t.v.! It was really handy for the Termini station (far enough away to not be bothered by the noise) & the subway & we felt safe walking in the area around the hotel at night. For a relatively cheap hotel I was more than happy with the standard.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateconway
Reviews.Content: My parents, my boyfriend and i spent a week in the hotel dest'e in november 2007 and we really can't fault it. Having read reviews on here before we left, i was somewhat concerned but from the moment we arrived our fears were put at ease. The reception staff were exceedingly helpful, pointing us in the direction of the best and cheapest shopping, reminding us to watch our handbags for pickpockets and always ready to answer our questions in passable to excellent english. The hotel itself is old italian style and not modern but there is a lift which comfortably fits 2 adults and 2 suitcases. Rooms are ensuite and airy, high ceilings and marble floors though sizes do vary, our room was large but bath room tiny (one at time size!) but my parents room on the floor below was smaller but with a larger bathroom. Beds were large and comfortable, and if you closed the window, road noise was negligble but to honest you don't notice after a couple of days. Room were were cleaned every day, fresh towels and sheets every other day. The only problem we could see with the hotel itself was that the water was hot or scalding but after 2 days got the hang of the shower taps and all was well. The breakfast was a substantial continetal, pastrys, bread, cheese, ham and yoghurts, selection of cereals and fruits. It is self service and you can have as much as you like. There are no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms and no bar but there is a huge selection of winebars and coffee shops less than a 5 min walk away and nothing to stop you bringing back cheese and wine to your room for your midnight snack as it comes with a fridge! It is ideally located 2 mins walk from st. mary major church (we could see it from our balcony) and from the subway in the other direction. We walked to all the major historical sites in rome from the dest'e except for the vatican when we used the subway. Fundementally if you have come to rome to see the sites and experience the lifestyle and want a clean, comfortable hotel to sleep and wash in, with a breakfast that sets you up for the days walking from a central location then the dest'e is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: england20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it's the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Firstly, the area it's located in looks unfriendly and dirty. When we arrived at our room our safety deposit box did not work and when we asked the manager for a new one he said he could not provide us with one and said that we don't really need one anyway! But if anything was stolen, the hotel would not be responsible, so we had to carry our money and travel documents with us everywhere we went. The room was basic and the breakfast was average. The walls were thin so we could hear everything for adjoining rooms and did not sleep much. Overall, I would strongly suggest not staying there if you like a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: pro-travelguy
Reviews.Content: I was stuck with this hotel for four nights and would not recommend it. As a single traveler; I expected a small room, very small room and did get it. However I did not expect to not have hot water, just tepid, a broken fridge in the room, a TV that's remote controls did not work. The staff at the desk were not helpful and did not care. The breakfast consisted of a roll and a coffee machine. The 'restaurant and bar' area were only open for breakfast. Lots of other so-called 3-star hotels in Rome that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Elderwoman
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for one night, as we were just passing through and wanted something close to the train station. Previously, we had stayed at the Guibileo, just across the street, which we really liked, but they were full so we settled for this one despite less-than perfect reviews and prepaid it through an agency. When we arrived at the Hotel D'Este, we were told that the hotel was fully booked and there was no room for us, even though the receptionist had a document on her desk with our booking clearly shown on it. She said that the problem was the agency's fault because the booking was received too late (a total crock as I had booked at least six weeks earlier) and all the rooms had already been filled. It was a case, she said, of 'first come first served'. We knew this to be a lie. For one thing, it was still afternoon and also another couple arrived after us and were able to check straight in. They would not give us a room, but sent us by car to another hotel they own (The Repubblica) which is so basic that it felt more like a backpackers hostel than a hotel. I had avoided booking the Repubblica because I had read reviews of it which were almost all bad. We've stayed in some pretty grim places in our time, but not at these three-star prices!! I guess the only way they can fill the Repubblica is to overbook the D'Este and then 'walk' the hapless guests like us who turn up with pre-paid vouchers. Obviously, the only people who get to stay at the D'Este are those who have not pre-paid, who have booked more than one night and are thus more likely to walk out if not treated properly. These people own the D'Este, the Repubblica and the Augusta (next door to the Repubblica and looks like another fleapit). I suggest you avoid all three.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced 3 Star with good location near major sights”
Reviews.Author: ambough
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night stay at D'Este Hotel in Jan. 2007 thru a travel agent in Naples. The Hotel is conveniently located 5 minutes from Rome's main Termini train station and also a short 5 min. walk from one of the metro lines, which made it easy to get across town to see the Vatican/Sistine Chapel sights. Colosseum/Forum/other ancient Rome sights were about a 15 minute walk away, and there were restaurants nearby. If you are looking for a smaller, European-style boutique hotel in a good location at a reasonable price, D'Este may be perfect. Our room was clean, comfortable, had cable TV and a private bath with tub/shower and hairdryer. Nothing luxurious but completely comfortable for a 2 night stay. Nice buffet breakfast was included in the rate. Front desk staff was helpful & spoke excellent English which was nice since our Italian was very very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been good... but isn't.”
Reviews.Author: stulp
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good. At some point in history, the building itself must have looked quite nice as well. And we had a nice view from the balcony. However... The english proficiency of (all) the desk staff depends on their current mood, which was usually bad. The breakfast , if anything, may help to improve your jaw musculature. One of the foldable beds in our "twin" room was slanted, squeecky, and way too short for me. I switched hotels, and found a cheaper and much nicer hotel. What is most depressing is that the desk staff and manager obviously dislike working in the hotel as much as I did staying in it. To immensely improve the service, I suggest to exchange the desk staff with the cleaning staff, who were always helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap, central accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Iason_Angelos
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried as the normal place I stay was full, and as usual booked BEFORE checking it out on traipadvisor. Have to say I was pleasantly suprised after reading negative reviews. Its not the Waldorf but I paid €90 for a double room in high season. I was only using the hotel to sleep and shower(which is all you need a Hotel for in Rome), but it was clean, and spacious enough. I hear the top floor rooms are the nicest with a pleasant view, and if you want to save some money to spend on clothes and food, save it on your accommodation, as I guarantee you will not spend a lot of time there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyWill
Reviews.Content: When i went to my travel agent i asked her for a cheap hotel that was in the middle of Rome. So i got what i paid/asked for. This hotel is just average. I didn't have any problems with cold water like some previous posts i read. The rooms were very small though but thats typical of European hotels. My only real complaint is the paper thin walls! They are real bad! I stayed in 308 and i can say that i heard everything! People walking up stairs, rolling over in bed, etc. Also, the neighborhood that its located isnt italian at all. Its mostly middle eastern/asian. I don't have anything against that, but if your looking for italian, stay away from Esquiline neighborhood. I did love the Santa Marria Maggiere church that is located directly next to it. It is a lesser know church in italy that is beautiful and is free to check out. If your looking for nice places to eat/have fun in close to the hotel. I would suggest walking down Via Cavour. I hung out at the Mary Love Bar alot while i was there and the owner (Francesco) is a real cool guy there. If anyone has any questions. Feel free to message me! Ciao everyone! -Anthony

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveBrien
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place to stay ..5 mins from Termini Station and 2 mins from Church San Maggiore...We were met by Chinese front of desk who was extremly helpful, gave us a free map of rome and explained all bus and train stops for major attractions. Buffet breakfast in the morning was more than adequate. My parrents had a room that was to the front on 3rd floor and they said it was a bit noisey early in the morning. We had a room to the rear on 4th floor which over looked dining area and other appartments. The lift can only accomodate 2 people at at time and the steps up to the 4 th floor are a killer!!! Would totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for one of the rmodeled rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Corina1231
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning in our room at the Hiberia was not working. We had friends staying next to the D'Este Hotel at the Montreal. The Montreal did not have rooms available but the D'Este did. My husband was allowed to see one of the rooms and left a deposit. When we got back later that night we were given a very dark dreary room on the 4th floor with a cracked bath drain, spots on the walls, and mold spots on the shower curtain. We had just left a very nice hotel and I was on the verge of tears. My husband talked to the manager and we were given a remodeled room on the 1st floor that was very nice. The room was large, clean and had a new shower. The money we saved staying at the D'Este paid for a trip to Euro Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Not Spectacular, but Ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I decided I wanted to stay in Rome, I only had 2 months to make the reservations, and I think that I now understand why this hotel still had rooms available. I made reservations at this hotel for 9 people and when I arrived the hotel only had beds reserved for three, even though they had a copy of the email which clearly stated there were 9 staying that night. Then they sent half of our party over to another hotel owned by the same person which happened to cost quite a bit more. Then the man who checked us in, told me to take the hotel shuttle to the airport to pick up my family; he assured me it would only cost 10 Euro per person, after which he charged us 65 Euro explaining that I had misunderstood him, even though I am fluent in Italian and have lived in Italy for two years. While the location of the hotel is extremely convenient for the train station, there are much nicer hotels in the area. To top things off, we asked the hotel for a good restaurant nearby for our last night in Rome and were sent to a horrible place which is named named "Bella Roma" where my grandmother discovered a fly in her salad and the wait staff proceeded to mock us after the fact. All-in-all the hotel was ok. I would not however recommend staying here unless you are unable to find anywhere else at all.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there three days. My room was okay. It was clean and comfortable, albeit small. Of course, small isn't surprising in Europe. Breakfast was okay, but nothing to get excited about. My major complaint was the heating. I was there in the beginning of December, so of course, the heat was turned on. That would have been fine, except I had no way to control the temperature in my room. I'd typical come home from the day of sightseeing and my room was 90+ F. The only way I could stay or sleep in there was to open the window and use it to regulate the temperature. I complained about this, but they told me they couldn't do anything... I'm just glad I don't (directly) have to pay that heating bill!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: PMHaverhill
Reviews.Content: The lack of air conditioning was a problem. We were told the entire city turns off AC on Sept 15th - not the case. Other than that, the hotel was clean and convenient, although a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “It should have been nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome, as a city which is blessed with a lot of cultural content originating from thousands of years ago, has this hotel within its perimiters. The Hotel is disappointing. I payed too much money for the service I recieved. The only positive thing about this place was the loaction. For anyone who is infact thinking about this hotel, please consider carefully what exactly what you are looking for Yours sincerely, anonimus

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Italy before I knew that I could not expect much from a 3 star hotel in Rome. However, it was a lot worse than even I expected. When we arrived at our room it was obvious that it had not been cleaned. The beds were made, but there were empty toilet paper rolls and huge dustballs on the floor of the room. The toilet seat cover was literally on the floor, and when we notified the front desk the manager threw a fit about how it was not his fault that the maid had not informed him of the situation. The refrigerator was broken, and so was the remote control for the TV. The room smelled like smoke although this was supposed to be a non smoking hotel. We were never able to locate the restaurant or the terrace in the hotel. The location was good, very near Stazione Termini, in what seems to be the emerging China Town of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel D'Este”
Reviews.Author: cmt2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel D'Este whilst on a sightseeing. The choice was mainly based on location. After reading some poor reviews I was pleased to see that the hotel was a lot better than expected. Room was clean and tidy although a little on the small side, though this wasnt a problem as the purpose of the visit was sightseeing and very little time was spent in the room. Staff were friendly and helpfull at all times. A buffet style breakfast was served in a pleasant dining area and would probably suit the majority of visitors. There are plenty of eating places nearby the hotel. The location being just five minutes walk from the central termini makes it an ideal base for a sightseeing tour. The hotel is good value for money and I will be using it again and would recomend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter067
Reviews.Content: From the moment my family entered this hotel and was told they did not have our booking until the time we left unshowered and tired it was a horrible experience and totally ruined this special family trip. We were there for two nights and once they found our booking we were given a twin and a twin pretending to be a double room. There were complaints from guests as we entered the lobby "No hot water" We heard how the manager calmly and with a smile on his face asured the guests that there would be hot water in one hour. We decided to judge the hotel for ourselves and stayed the two nights. Our childrens room smelt of urine, Neither room had hot water and we discover that "In one hour" was the stock answer to any problems. We did not see the hot water. The hotel was noisy and sparce. The second night there was a fire alarm but unfotunately the bell on our floor did not work and we only knew of the evacuation of the hotel when the guests from the other floors returned in vocal harmony to the hotel (thank God there was no fire for real or we would be history.) The attitude of the staff at the hotel was one of apathy. Guests were now refusing to pay their bills, unfortunately ours was pre-paid through the booking agents Octopus Travel. I have no issues with Octopus Travel as they have a good service and hopefully after informing them of our experience they will drop this hotel from their list. I strogly recommend avoiding this hotel and making a note that 3 star in Rome is not always the same as 3 star in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as described”
Reviews.Author: Alford
Reviews.Content: While we can't complain about the presentation and cleanliness of the hotel it was a disappointment in that it did not have the facilities we were led to believe it offered from descriptions on various websites. However, the decor and furniture are very traditional, everywhere is air conditioned. Rooms clean but basic. Very small area downstairs with a couple of sofas. This was a non smoking hotel. It transpired that there was not a roof terrace, the restaurant was a on the first floor of the internal quad. The restaurant was a quaint wooden building set into the quad space. There was a small area actually outside but not in use during our stay, anyway the view would have been balconies of surrounding apartments and their washing! The restuarant/bar is only open for breakfast which as someone else has said was somewhat on the light side. There is no bar in the hotel and no coffee making facilities so you can not get refreshments in the hotel. The mini bar was in the room as promised but stocked with only two small bottles of water. Our bathroom light did not work and they were unable to put in another bulb and there were no other rooms available. We left after one night. We picked up a hotel brochure on leaving which mentions the roof terrace, restaurant, bar etc and has pictures of the hotel that even standing there we couldn't locate! Turning left outside the hotel you will find yourself in a very ordinary city full of chinese shops and hardly any cafes however turn right and you are minutes from St Maria Maggiore Basillica which is surrounded by many good restaurants and cafes. Although this is handily very close to Termini railway station it was a nice area. Easy walking distance to the sights too. If you are just looking for a clean place to lay your head without any facilities then the D'este will suit you fine. However we found several other hotels which had more facilities and were cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel D'Este is OK!”
Reviews.Author: GeirOslo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and myself stayed 4 nights in March 2004. We were actually together with 3 more couples (all age around 40) We all thought this was a nice experience, without making us overexcited. Desent service, OK breakfast in a light and pleasant breakfastroom, clean rooms though they varied much in size. Some rooms VERY small, others spacious. I cannot give a five star reviev and 4 is maybe too good but between 3 and 4 is the best value. Nothing were great but in general it was Ok. We didnt stay much at the hotel anyway. Beds were good. Fine location, 10 minute walk to Colloseum. Some noise for rooms toward street. Towards the backyard it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel d'Este for 4 nights in October 2003. Having read a 2002 bad review, we were pleasantly surprised. Although the hotel has about 30 bedrooms, it is more akin to a large nicely decorated Italian-style mansion on 4 floors. Grand reception hall, staircases and hallways, and large bedrooms with good beds - recently installed double glass French windows keep out traffic noise; and there is air conditioning. The staff could not have been more helpful. The hotel is near the subway - which makes it convenient for reaching easily most of Rome's visitor attractions. Where Hotel d'Este needs to improve greatly is the standard of the Continental breakfast served in it's spacious wigwam style "garden room" (in wood) at the rear. This was very poor indeed, with staffing almost non-existent. Not the best way to begin a long day of visits to attractions. If the hotel can get it's breakfasts up to its otherwise high standards, we can recommend Hotel d'Este as a good, moderately priced, easily accessible place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: D'Este Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Carlo Alberto 4/B, 00185 Rome, Italy
